subject: Sales
title: The Six Weapons of Influence
description: A quick win: understand The Six Weapons of Influence.

hook.text: Cialdini went undercover at car dealerships and cults to learn how persuasion actually works.

buildup.text: He found six principles that explain nearly every instance of human influence throughout history.

discovery.text: Reciprocity, commitment, social proof, authority, liking, and scarcity. Six levers that move anyone.

twist.text: These principles work whether the persuader is ethical or manipulative. The tools are morally neutral.

climax.text: Understanding them is essential â€” not just to persuade, but to protect yourself from being persuaded.

punchline.text: Six principles explain almost all human persuasion.

quiz.question: How did Cialdini research persuasion principles?
options: Going undercover at sales and influence organizations
